Summary: Our families rented out this hotel for the wedding party and we held the rehearsal dinner in the courtyard. Can’t say enough about how helpful and friendly the staff was. Every single person was eager to help and had a smile on their face. Katie’s attention to detail for the rehearsal dinner definitely contributed to a magical evening. Everything was beautiful and we were so pleased!

Summary Heading: Most perfect & gorgeous hotel for my wedding celebration
Summary: My husband and I rented out the hotel for our wedding celebration in October, and we were blown away by how perfect every little aspect was. Not only is the hotel beyond gorgeous, but the staff was UNBELIEVABLE. Every single person there felt like a friend and the accommodations were beyond perfection.   The rooms are so unique, clean & bright. The morning coffee service just makes you feel right at home. The food is absolutely incredible, the drinks are fresh and the bartenders are just amazing people.   I highly highly recommend Hotel Joaquin not only for a weekend getaway but for any events -- this place is it. The whole wedding was seamless and so stress free thanks to them.
Room tip: Auric & La vue are my two favorite rooms! But you truly can't go wrong
Manager Response: none

The room was perfect and outfitted with everything we needed. Room 21 is upstairs on the corner and has sweeping views of the ocean. Highly recommended. Looking forward to staying here again in the future. Shoutout to Chris at the front desk and Chef Leo for being the best!

Manager Response: none

Summary: I cannot wait to tell you all about Hotel Joaquin! I was nervous after reading a couple negative reviews but I am here to let you know that this place is incredible. I do a lot of traveling globally and have stayed in all kinds of places - I think I have a good idea of what a great place provides: Hotel Joaquin is not cheap but the quality of the experience is worth it.   Hotel: Gorgeous interior, from the front desk to the pool, the landscaping and decor are in great taste - the front of the hotel is unassuming but the minute you open the front door, you are hit with a view all the way to the ocean - it has an interesting design, not incredibly accessible for wheelchair users but they do have chair lifts to get to the main levels but I would imagine not all the rooms are ADA
Room tip: Mountain rooms are louder - it's worth it to pay more for an ocean view!

Summary: Liked: Cute boutique hotel. Liked the simple designs, good taste, and quietness. Staff was friendly and helpful. The pool had enough chairs to accommodate all current guests. They bring you coffee in the AM at your desired waking time in your room, which was a nice detail. They have yoga on Saturday morning on the roof top, which I enjoyed. The staff communicates via text and books reservations for you around town efficiently.  Disliked  · So many things....I arrived and upon checking in, realized that my $600+/night room (The Thalia Room) was practically in the basement, without any natural light. They are a hotel, dealing with domestic and international travelers on a daily basis. The least they can do is show that they care about the health and safety of its occupants by wearing a mask. Summary Heading: My favorite hotel on this trip !
Summary: My husband and I we’re on a 10 day trip visiting friends and family and hotel Joaquin was our final hotel. It was my favorite!! At first I thought our room would be noisy but not in the least. I guess requesting a room you should request an interior property room. They all face a small courtyard and a lovely pool with lots of double lounge chairs.   I did love the vicinity. Close to all the restaurants that we had reservations at.  The price tag is hefty. There is not a full breakfast in the morning. It had a small… Sampling of a menu. We did not eat there.  Here’s my favorite part. The rejuvenation antique brass fixtures. Their soaps are by Le Labo. My favorite scent Santal 33 !!!!  The shower was quite large. I loved it. We can’t wait to return!

Summary: We loved staying here.  The atmosphere is so breezy and chill.   The food and service were spectacular.  I can’t stress that part enough. The staff here were so accommodating and so eager to please. It was  incredibly  relaxing to stay here and we would absolutely come back again. We had come in for a ohana Festival. It was a little out-of-the-way and getting a ride back on the three evenings was a little challenging but the stay was so wonderful we would put up with that again a heartbeat.
Manager Response: Thank you for your nice words. We are grateful we could add to your Ohana experience. We hope to see you again. All the best.

Summary: Really enjoyed our time here over the holiday weekend. Very quaint and quiet oasis. We decided to stay in and eat at the restaurant two nights in a row just to be able to make it through all the menu options. Definitely go for the lamb meatballs and the gnocchi. Room was on the smaller side but we enjoyed having some lazy mornings with coffee on the little patio just off the bedroom.  We both enjoyed having the text communication with the staff as they were very helpful with questions and responded to requests quickly. Recommend getting a cocktail or two while you're here. Nick and Cody have come up with some interesting drinks we had never heard of before. Sitting at the bar with them was a cool experience while overlooking the Pacific.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your comments. I am glad you enjoyed your stay/drinks and had time to interact with our team. Hope to see you again soon.

Summary: We would highly recommend Hotel Joaquin. The location is perfect -- 150 yards to beach access, pool with ocean view on premise, staff was amazing and very attentive throughout the course of our stay. The food and drinks are also top notch so stop by the bar and Saline restaurant. Different rentals are available from snorkeling to bicycles are available during your stay.  Definitely worth the visit if passing through or staying in OC!
Manager Response: Hello Leo! I am so glad to hear you enjoyed your experience. We so look forward to welcoming you back soon!

Summary Heading: My favorite place to stay in Orange County!
Summary: I love everything about Hotel Joaquin. It is one of my favorite hotels in Orange County and I am always excited to stay there! I've stayed here 5 times in the past year, there's a reason why I keep coming back!  The hotel itself is intimate and quiet which make it a perfect place to relax and get away from the craziness of life. It's steps away from my favorite beach, Shaw's Cove, and the staff are always so friendly and helpful when I've interacted with them.  The rooms are decorated with intention and so much thought which made me feel right at home. I can't say enough about how much I love the decor and design of the entire property. My favorite room I've stayed in is definitely SOLEIL, it has a gorgeous view of the ocean and a stunning bathroom with a tub! My second favorite
Manager Response: Hello Jaime, you are part of our "house" as I can see you truly understand where we are coming from. Serenity and nice people. All the best.

Summary Heading: A nice stay, but not worth the price
Summary: This hotel is a quaint property with lovely ocean views, centrally located in Laguna Beach. However, I would not say it's worth the almost $600 price tag per night. Although the bathroom in our room was quite spacious, the room itself was pretty small, with the bed and our suitcases taking up most of the space. We also had a room facing the highway, which made for a noisy night of cars whipping by at all hours. I enjoyed my stay, but would not pay $600 to experience it again.
Manager Response: Hello Victoria, I am sad to hear that your stay was not all to your satisfaction. Please come and visit us and check out a different room. Call us directly, we will take care of you.

Summary Heading: One of the Best in OC
Summary: I've stayed at the Hotel Joaquin dozens of times.  It's a very quaint hotel with only 20 plus rooms situated a couple blocks off the ocean.  The rooms are pristine, the staff very professional and accommodating and the pool is equally amazing.  Be sure to check out the bar and have Cohdy or Nick make one of their specialty drinks.  Saline, the hotel restaurant, is a must for those desiring to stay on the hotel grounds for the duration of their stay.  I'd give this place 10 stars if I could.  Definitely a must see if passing through the OC.
Manager Response: Hello and thank you so much for your nice words. We honored to have you as our guest every time you visit. See you soon.

Summary Heading: I'm a local, yet I felt I was on holiday
Summary: I live in a nearby beach community and I decided to book a two night stay with a visiting friend.  I did not have the time for a proper destination holiday, so I decided to splurge on beach hotel during high season.    I regularly  visit friends who live in Laguna so I know the town well, but I truly felt transported and completely relaxed. The pool with cocktails at sundown was my favorite.  I stayed in "Mer" which was a lovely spacious room with a view.  Staff was very pleasant and hospitable.  Wished we had experienced dinner, but the restaurant was closed the nights we stayed.
Manager Response: We are glad that we could transport you into a different and our world. Making guests feel far away and leave their day to day worries at home is our goal. We hope to see you again soon.

I knew I was spending a lot but my goodness the lowest available rooms were not worth the $600/night expense.   There's a text concierge service that's wonderful when there's a response, however, on several occasions the text was not addressed. I'm not used to service like that so was extremely grateful for it when I could get it, I just wish I was acknowledged or told service may be slower because of a staff shortage. Same thing with breakfast service, Alonso was absolutely fantastic given the circumstances, however, I would have appreciated the lower rate and/or a heads up the service would be compromised. We arrived early and although I realized we couldn’t check into our room I didn’t know it meant we couldn’t be on the property at all. Not the pool, not the bar… very odd. There was no one at the front desk to check us in so we had to wait to speak to someone. Breakfast was included but it’s the same 4 items every morning which get old fast. Breakfast service is terribly slow as they only have 1 man service everyone. I expected a higher level of service here. For 2 nights with all the taxes and resort fees it was $2,000. This small boutique hotel is definitely not worth it.

Summary: First of all, thank you to the entire staff for being amazing during my time here. Special shoutout to Nick and Cody for some of the best cocktails I have ever had in my life. Never experienced a 18+ hotel outside of Mexico and this was a cool feature.  Pros: -Rooms with ocean view are definitely worth it -Bike rentals on the house was a great touch -STAFF! Cannot say enough nice things as they were all very attentive and took great care of me Cons: -Limited hours for cocktails. Only 3:00-10:00pm *only a con because they are so great* -Weather is spotty here as there is marine layer until late in the afternoon.  -Noise from other guests. The room rates and everything else (drinks, bar snacks) are like 4 star prices when at the end of the day, you're staying at a renovated hotel. Yes, the decor is nice and the lobby and some rooms have an ocean view. But it still was not worth it. We paid $369 per night in March (not even high season) plus crazy taxes plus a ridiculous $45 per night resort fee! What's included in the $45 resort fee? Beats me. For two nights we spent $950 not including any drinks which were about $17 per drink. The pool and pool area was meh. No one was tidying up as people were leaving.   It is a nice upgraded motel, but that's all it is. It's upsetting that they think it's a 4 star

I love that there are no TVs in the whole hotel. It was the perfect digital detox. I put a record on (all rooms come with record players) and then had a relaxing bath (brought my own salts and candles - but you can pay extra for theirs to be ready in room if you want). The property is quite spread out and even though the hotel was nearly fully booked during my stay, there was always lots of room around the pool and the common areas.  Booking online was easy.   After much thinking I booked the Azur room which was very quiet and has a small Juliet balcony that faces a side street with a peak at the ocean. The service is lacking and the staff are in need of some training,  Covid aside they have some work to do in order to get this property on track.  Some odd hours in bar as well - 3pm.  Service at the pool is also not great.  This can be a little 4 star gem with some help.

We won't be back and will not recommend Hotel Joaquin.

Not a phone or TV to be found. If that scares you, you’ll likely benefit from being here more than you realize. The walk back was just as nice, we would definitively recommend this Hotel Joaquin for a getaway. We are fortunate enough to live in Orange County (The OC), and felt like we were on a mini vacation.

This is a pocket sized boutique spot pays homage to a by gone era. It's small (22 rooms) quiet, causal, sophisticated and oozing with understated elegance.   Unobtrusive service that anticipates your need/want and delivers without being asked is the hallmark of the this new comer at the edge of Laguna Beach.   Take your nap listening to the vinyl records in your room. Laze by the pool with a drink or three. Fluffy towels and the sun goop you forgot to being are provided. Choose a premium room, it is absolutely worth it. The food alone will bring me back to the hotel (I highly recommend the croque monsieur for breakfast), but trust me, the entire experience is flawless.

Summary: What an amazing Hotel from top to bottom.  The staff, rooms, property and food are all off the charts!!  The croque monsieur for breakfast is something you cannot miss! A must stay when traveling to the O.C.!

From the welcome drinks, breakfasts, hikes up the hill with George and drinks by the pool we enjoyed every bit of the 4 days we spent there. While not on the beach, the two beaches within easy walks were beautiful. Not having a TV in the room created a bit of initial panic, but we adjusted and enjoyed the break from the bad news. It felt less like a hotel and more like staying at someone’s large and lovely home. We didn’t want to leave and hope to return! Fantastic stay.

But when I got my AMEX bill, I was shocked to find the room alone cost me over $1,700.00! For two nights. Yes the decor is hip and groovy, (albeit, tiny), but nothing grand. It's not ON the beach, it's on the coast highway, there is no valet, you park your car, your schlep your luggage,  no chocolate on the pillow... When I tried to clear things up - have the number adjusted to what I had signed off on, it was a NO GO. Even the gentleman who took my call was astonished when he saw what I'd
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Fabulous staff makes this lovely hotel worth it!
Summary: My daughter and I spent a weekend at Hotel Joaquin in July to celebrate her thirtieth birthday.  The room was lovely, the grounds beautiful, the location was great and the pool was delightful.  We enjoyed the yoga classes and thought the instructors were of high quality.  The food was superb!  I will spend years looking for a Crocque Monsieur that good!  One night we made reservations for the  chef's dinner with pairings and were the only ones that evening to do so.  The excellent chef asked what we liked to eat, cooked for us, joined us for some courses and regaled us with stories. We ate the most beautiful and delicious meal. What made the stay memorable was the delightful staff who were attentive and thoughtful.  They had the perfect combination of being friendly, interesting
Manager Response: none

Summary: Came here on a whim with my husband after a stressful week for privacy and relaxation. We were greeted with complimentary drinks and chaperoned to our room that had a breathless ocean view. The rooms are neutral with cool earthy tones. The 420 sqft room was luxurious and perfectly practical. Le labo toiletries complete the experience. You may or may not run into a celebrity here. Just saying. We will be revisiting this hotel soon!!
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Best Staff, Beautiful Facility, Didn’t Want to Leave
Summary: I don’t write reviews, good or bad, as a general rule. But rules were meant to be broken so here I go. This place is lit.  Every single person we interacted with was so friendly and helpful and professional, my daughter and I were blown away. We visited this hotel at the end of a long California road trip and it surpassed all that preceded it by a landslide, ooops, poor choice of words when speaking of a California hotel built on the side of a hill. The breakfast was fabulous, and the dinner stellar. The fantastic  sous chef Co came out and chatted with us to make sure everything was to our liking. The rooms were so comfy and clean and the space just gorgeous. Well done, Hotel Joaquin, well done.
Manager Response: none

Summary: The newcomer to Laguna, we were excited to try this boutique hotel with beach access and a pool. The aesthetics are beautiful, grounds perfectly manicured, the pool is quiet and peaceful (no jacuzzi), Main Street is 1/2 mile away, and Shaws Cove beach is just steps from Hotel Joaquin. Special thanks to Eric and George for providing us with daily umbrella, chairs and paddle boards at the beach! Every drink we had was fantastic. The complimentary breakfast is delicious and you can request coffee in your room as well. Now for the negatives...this hotel is in its infancy and unfortunately it shows in the service. For the $650 price tag per night (includes service fee, resort fee, taxes), Hotel Joaquin needs to keep up with the service provided by the bigger players in town (we have
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: The most charming hotel you’ll ever stay in!
Summary: Hotel Joaquin was the most incredible experience I've ever had while staying outside of home. On an anniversary staycation, my lady and I stayed here and were lucky enough to enjoy their chef's package. It was the best meal we've ever had in Laguna Beach, if not recent memory as a whole. The bar, the living room, the room itself (Maree), the pool, the amenities, the staff, nothing could have been more charming and attentive to detail. The entire place is an interior designer's dream. We found it hard to leave the room simply from the comfort and aesthetic it provided. We can't imagine staying anywhere else, and are more than eager to take the time off to simply stay a night here again just because. It made us feel completely foreign in the best way despite the fact we were so
Manager Response: none

Summary: I erred in booking Hotel Joaquin, thinking somehow that it was an oceanfront property. It is not. It faces on Coast Highway just blocks north of the center of Laguna Beach and down one block and several sturdy staircases to Shaw's Cove and beach. However, my error was  redeemed by the quality of the lodging. Our room 21 was small but immaculately furnished. The hotel is overseen by Reinhard Neubert, an exceedingly cordial gentleman with, literally, a world of hotel management experience both foreign and domestic. Staff are everywhere, always present and always helpful. Breakfast is included and the offerings are both generous and delicious. Dinner is available to hotel guests only and again, the choices and quality of the food are exceptional. It should be noted, however, that
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Magical and one of a kind
Summary: Both my husband and I loved Hotel Joaquin.  The renovation from old school CA beach motel is unique and well done as is the location, a quick two min walk to the beach and a bit longer walk to shops and restaurants.  We love swimming in the sea so we enjoyed a quick dip every day despite the cool weather. Cocktails are delicious, our room was immaculate with a very comfortable bed and great selection of albums.  Reception staff was gracious and welcoming. Some small glitches in room cleaning (ours was not done) and dining -- over cooked eggs (My husband waited for a new egg, I did not), the waiter not understanding that we wanted hot milk for our coffee -- and there is a limited selection for both breakfast and dinner.  Not complaining but a few more choices especially at
Manager Response: none

Summary: We had read reviews of Hotel Joaquin and thought it sounded perfect for us. Not quite. But first let me give you the pluses, which are many. The common spaces are great--the garden, rooftop, and the pool area (although it was too chilly to spend much time at the pool). The location is perfect--near the park, cove, the beach and downtown. The people who work at the hotel are very friendly and helpful and the restaurant was awesome. Breakfast (delicious) is made to order every morning and complimentary. Lunch and dinner menus, although limited, were good as well. Dominica, the bar tender, was a joy. Now to the negatives. We chose our room from the description on line and the one we chose said it had a "mountain view." Very misleading. The room was right on the main street with a
Manager Response: none

Summary: Stayed at Hotel Joaquin for one night during a work trip that took me down to Laguna. I was only there a night but I felt refreshed and recharged! It was gorgeous and I can't wait to go back and take advantage of all they have to offer, including their amazing activities concierge (paddle boarding out to the migrating whales anyone?) and enjoy more of the delicious food in their restaurant. It's a very unusual and refreshing hotel experience - feels like a home, everyone greets you, knows your name, and can't do enough to make you feel welcome. It's informal, but polished and upscale. Gorgeous dinner menu and excellent cocktails. Can't recommend highly enough!
Manager Response: none

Summary: Spent 2 nights at Hotel Joaquin last weekend, we were blown away but the property, food and service.  The hotel itself is about a mile from "downtown" and is super easy to get around as the free trolley picks up right next to the hotel.  Shaw's Cove is a 2 minute walk from our room and has an amazing beach.  Can't say enough about the beautiful room and the hotel grounds, a true oasis.      Ruth and the entire team were amazing!!!  Best cocktails in Laguna Beach by far.  Chef Leo and the culinary team were on point, all of the food was delicious and beautiful (visit the rooftop garden).  Wonderful stay, we will be back!!!
Manager Response: none

Summary: This was the perfect weekend getaway for my husband and I. The location is only a block away from the beach and walking distance to great shopping & restaurants.  Now, lets talk about the food...Breakfast: amazing granola bowl, farm eggs & pork sausage dish is delicious! Dinner: gnocchi mac & cheese, seabass perfectly cooked with coconut milk and forbidden rice, did I mention the fluffy panna cotta for dessert! BRAVO to Chef Leo!  Staff was so friendly, service was impeccable and the cocktails were amazing! Thank you Zach!   We will be back!
Manager Response: none

Summary: Hotel Joaquin a rare kind of perfection. From the moment we walked in the door, we were awestruck by the beautiful design elements, the incredibly caring and gracious staff, and the tranquil atmosphere. The room was pristine and the attention to detail was incredible -- from the record player to the artwork to the bathrobes -- every element is designed to cultivate relaxation, enjoyment and rejuvenation. And Chef Leo! This man is a genius and prepared one of the most magical meals I've ever had, not to mention the incredible staff who made sure our every need was met. I've never enjoyed a hotel stay as much as I did this one. We can't wait to come back. Thank you, Hotel Joaquin, for a truly exceptional experience.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: No TV's in rooms and Laguna has plenty of other options.
Summary: New properties sometimes over estimate the grandness of their hotel product...  I'm sorry...Yes it's a hotel with a good aesthetic  but "the laguna beach house hotel" has rooms just as suitable.  Hotel Joaquin has a nice breakfast included but laguna beach has - So many wonderful breakfast options if you walk 5 minutes.   Why is there NO TV? Just hide the TV or have it available for request.. why is it not advertised clearly for guest to be informed. Over priced -  It should be priced at $275 on the low - $350 on the high in total after taxes but that's not the rate it's double that. I could go to Beverly Hills and stay anywhere.
Manager Response: Hello U1988,  Thank you kindly for your feedback. We are sorry to hear that you did not feel your stay was worth the value. We regret that we didn’t meet and exceed your expectations, as doing so is our goal with all our guests. We hope that you choose to join us again for an opportunity to really feel the vibe and culture of Hotel Joaquin.  Warmest regards,

Summary: Loved it. Stayed with friends. Staff are all great. Bar is terrific. Awesome vibe. Pool is nice. Place is really really fun. Views are cool. Rooms are cool. Music instead of television. So fun! Recommend.
Manager Response: Hello 509,  We’re happy to hear there were so many aspects of your stay that you enjoyed. We strive to provide an exceptional experience in every aspect of our business and we’re glad you could see that. We hope to have an opportunity to see you again soon!  Warmest regards,

Summary: We stayed here for one night. The hotel is great! The staff is even better!!! Friendly, helpful, attentive (but not TOO attentive). We went to the pool and there was someone there immediately to see if we wanted a drink, snack or just a glass of ice water. One of the best features which we didn't have time to take advantage of is their selection of activity accessories. Bikes, kayaks, surfboards, body boards, etc. The hotel is 1 short block from beach access stairs. The staff will set up beach chairs, umbrella, beach towels. While on the beach you can still communicate to the staff via text which is monitored continuously. The rooms are individualized and VERY nice. Keep in mind that the property was a run down motor in 3 years ago which has been completely renovated. So while
Manager Response: Hello Chris,  Thank you for your review – it really hits on all the high points that make our property such a great place to stay. Our team works very hard to ensure that your breath is taken away at every point of your time with us. We are delighted that you enjoyed your time at the pool and beach along with the petite resort amenities. It sounds like a great time and we would be happy to work with you next reservation to ensure you get the perfect room for the next visit!   Warmest regards,

Summary: I recently had an excellent stay at Hotel Joaquin! The property has been expertly designed and exudes California-cool vibes throughout.  It truly has a resort feel, where you can find everything you want right on property.    I was in the Barto room which was fresh and bright with a comfortable bed and sitting area; bathroom was gorgeous with a large marble double-sink and spacious walk-in shower with soaking tub.  I loved the attention to detail with the finishes and décor.  The room even had a patio/balcony area where you can sit and enjoy the view and nice weather.  Each room has a record player with a selection of vinyl to entertain you... and you can always borrow some records from the living room too!          The grounds were expertly maintained with a pool area with
Manager Response: Hello Traveler,  We appreciate you spending time with us on your visit to Laguna Beach, and we appreciate the kind words you have made about our ambassadors. It's always our hope that we have some of the most passionate individuals in hospitality which make it easy to create a relaxing and unique guest experience. We strive to provide a mystical, peaceful oasis from the room to the grounds to the adventures and the culinary experience. We will be sure to pass along your kind words to our team and can’t wait for your next visit.  Warmest regards,

Summary: I had heard great things about Hotel Joaquin prior to arriving, however my experience visiting for two nights with my husband far surpassed anything I could have hoped for. The design is stunning, it is elevated and yet comfortable and casual. They paid attention to detail and the fine craftsmanship shows. The GM, Reinhard, The adventure guru, George, Chef Leo and all of the staff was wonderful and attentive. They really take the time to make you feel at home. The room we stayed in was the Shaw's room. It was spacious and had a large window looking straight out to the ocean. The bathroom finishes and color palette were spa like and the toiletries provided were top notch. I took advantage of the 9am yoga both mornings and it was such a treat to do yoga while staring at the ocean.
Manager Response: Hello A,  We never tire of telling guests like you “thank you” for taking the time to share your thoughts. Our ambassadors each take their area of responsibility seriously, creating a personalized experience, and our hope is you leave still thinking about the relaxing and unique guest experience. We are thrilled to hear you truly felt the culture and vibe we strive to reach with all of our guests. Please come back and see us any time!  Warmest regards,

Summary: We have stayed at one of Auric Road’s sister properties - Lone Mountain Ranch -for years.  When we realized that this place was one of their newer properties, we were excited to try it out.  We left the kids behind, and drove over.  Intimate, quirky, neat rooms, great location.  The staff are attentive....like friends. The restaurant (Saline) has a chef from Argentina, and the dinner was divine.  We had the tuna and kale for our appetizers, and the sea bass and steak for our entrees.  It felt like a secret that hasn’t yet gotten out...I have a feeling that it will soon. Overall, an outstanding experience.  About what I’d expect from anyone connected with Lone Mountain Ranch.
Manager Response: Hello Thomas,  We really appreciate your loyalty to our brand and business. Guests like you become part of our extended family. Our staff does a great job of making sure your stay is unforgettable and they’ll be happy to know the experience provided made a difference. Anytime you’d like to come back and enjoy our piece of paradise, we’d be happy to assist you with your reservation.  Warmest regards,

Summary: From our initial view of the property to everyone on the staff from the bartenders, Zack and Chase, all of the service personnel and the wonderful chef Alejandro. I spent two wonderful evenings and some great food along with some wonderful conversations. I recommend this hotel
Manager Response: Hello J,  We are thrilled to hear how much you enjoyed your culinary experience. We will be sure to pass along your kind words to our team members who work diligently to ensure your overall experience is unique. We are delighted to hear you would recommend our petite resort and surely hope you will return one day.  Warmest regards,

Summary Heading: Staycation that you never want to leave
Summary: My girlfriend and I decided to have a little staycation not to far from home just for a weekend. I could not believe as soon as I walked into Hotel Joaquin reality was gone and I was in paradise. We were greeted at the door by Chris who offered us a  complementary spritz. After our tour of the property we were showed our room which was right by the garden that they also hold yoga in the morning. The room was quiet, light and open...the perfect place to put on a record listen to music. We both had dinner at the hotel which did not disappoint. Sarah was our server, she took the time to answer all our questions about anything on the menu. Zach from the bar gave us pairing options of wine to go with the meals we ordered. Chef Ko came out and greeted us at our table. Even though you
Manager Response: Hello Haley,  That unique and boutique experience you had is exactly what we are aiming to deliver here. We are ecstatic to hear how much you enjoyed every aspect of your experience. We have shared your kind words with all of our staff. It is wonderful to hear the things you enjoyed most and hope we can serve you again in the future!  Warmest regards,

Summary: My friend and I came here for a short relaxing getaway. From the moment we walked through the door, this place exceeded my expectations. Everyone who works there is SO nice and down to earth. They treated us to a welcome drink and carried our bags in from our cars. There isn't a lot of parking but we got lucky and found spots right on the side of the hotel! The room was super clean and cute. The entire place has a calm and relaxing vibe. The food was AMAZING, so fresh and healthy. I wish I could’ve stayed longer to participate in the morning yoga and hiking excursions they offered. I could go on about this place but you should go see it for yourself!
Manager Response: Hello Caitlin,  Your kind words have been well-received by all of us. It is our pleasure to leave our guests with positive vibes and a lasting impression. Our ambassadors take their area of responsibility seriously, knowing that when everyone is doing their job, it makes for a relaxing and unique guest experience. We look forward to welcoming you back and hope to see that you enjoy yoga or a hike next time around.  Warmest regards,

Summary: This hotel is one of a kind. You have all the luxuries of a top hotel plus the feeling of being in a home. The decor is so tasteful, food thoughtfully created and the staff so attentive and friendly. Could only wish we could have stayed longer. Will definitely return if given the chance.
Manager Response: Hello Laura,  We very much appreciate your thoughtful review! We are so glad that you felt at home at our property. We hope to welcome you for longer next time so we may have some adventures!  Warmest Regards,  Reinhard Neubert General Manager

Summary: This hotel is such a wonderful temporary home.  The decoration is spot on, the food deliciously curated by a talented chef, the bedrooms extremely comfortable and the bathtubs are what dreams are made of!! The staff is also so nice and caring. They will adapt for you and always have a smile on. With direct access to the beach, this calm delicately decorated hotel will conquer you as it conquered us!
Manager Response: We hope we have a chance to welcome you back to your temporary home very soon! Thank you so much for the kind words about our staff and decor!   Warmest Regards,  Reinhard Neubert General Manager

Summary: I almost never write hotel reviews but this experience was truly exceptional, and wanted to share because it's such a terrific deal. The design is stunning and just the right balance of style and comfort, loved the art on the walls, the records you could take back and play in your room, the perfectly made cocktails, the robes in the rooms, the enormous shower, the bathtub. The bathrooms are marble and SO well done, feels like you are in a luxury hotel in Paris, and the beds and bedding are insanely comfortable. The dinner was delicious, the chef (Leo) who was formerly at the Sunset Tower in LA could not be more talented or charming. We just loved all the starters and the market fish was out of this world. We were not super hungry at breakfast but ate it anyway -- the home made
Manager Response: Thank you so much Charles for taking the time to write out such a kind review! We are very happy that you enjoyed all of the details of our property and the care that we put into making this place a home. We are happy to hear that your sports coat made it home safely as well!   Warmest Regards,  Reinhard Neubert General Manager

Summary: My wife and I stayed the night at Hotel Joaquin for a romantic concert and rest without our kids. It was EXACTLY what we needed. It honestly feels like a retreat center for the soul—we felt so cared for, from the moment we walked in we were attended to so thoughtfully, offered drinks, given a detailed description of the hotel and our room. After given all the information we needed, we were left alone to rest, and texted about what we would like for our coffee delivery the next morning. We put records on instead of the TV and rested on the most amazing bed and linens, and the most amazing robes! As parents and a younger couple, we were so impressed and went home so refreshed. Thanks Hotel Joaquin for being so thoughtful in everything you've brought to Laguna!
Manager Response: Hello William,  I am happy to hear that you and your wife were able to take full advantage of our adults getaway vibe during your time with us. Every parent deserves rest, relaxation and pampering when they can find the time. We take great pride in providing the best possible experience to our guests and thank you for all the kind words. We hope to see you both back at Hotel Joaquin!

Summary Heading: The best thing to ever happen to Laguna!!
Summary: I’ve just returned from my stay at Hotel Joaquin and my only regret was that I didn’t book more than one night. It was the perfect staycation to celebrate my anniversary with my boyfriend. The hospitality I experienced at Hotel Joaquin far surpassed many luxury hotels I've stayed at (Aman, Rosewood, etc.) GM Reinhard has curated a truly exceptional team at this property.   My boyfriend and I were enamored by the midcentury design of the lobby and rooms. We loved the welcome spritzes, breakfast offerings, heated pool, record library, coffee service, and high-quality bedsheets. However, what made our stay unforgettable was the lovely team at Hotel Joaquin.   Cohdy is the warmest and friendliest! He managed to make my booking experience fun and exciting. He even showed me and my
Manager Response: Hello Nicole,  Its always great to receive a glowing shout out about the culture of true hospitality we work so hard to provide all our guests and the lasting impression our whole team was able to provide to you both. Its nice to hear you were able to experience all the property has to offer. We thank you for choosing to share such a special occasion with us and we all hope to see you back very soon!

Summary: I was so excited to randomly stumble upon Hotel Joaquin's website while looking for a hotel in Laguna - and to score the last room available on the site for the night we were going to be in town vising from the east coast.  They completely lived up to all of our expectations!  The staff was so friendly, kind and generous with suggestions of places to go.  The welcome cocktails were spectacular and it was so refreshing to take a break from a regular hotel room with tv.  We loved the vintage vinyl collection and fresh breakfast.  Would highly recommend this hotel!  Area Tips: Go explore/hike at Top of the World and grab a sunset cocktail at The Deck!
Manager Response: Hello Jessica,  It sounds like it was fate that you were able to get the last room with us for your trip to Laguna and it's so great to hear that you were able to explore all that it has to offer with the hikes, great local venues and the classic sunset cocktail at The Deck. I am happy you were able to unplug and enjoy the vinyl collection as it is one of my favorite aspects of our property too. Thank you for the kind words and we all hope to see you back at Hotel Joaquin soon!

Summary: I don't know that writing about Hotel Joaquin will do it justice - you have to experience it for yourself! It's very unassuming from the outside but when you walk in, you find yourself in the living room of your dream home. They have an extensive vinyl collection for you to choose from to listen to in the lobby or to take back to your room - a great way to spark conversation with the other guests. The interior design details of the rooms were beautiful and one of the most comfortable beds I've slept in.   The service is absolutely impeccable and friendly - they have a text system to ease communication any time you need something from your room. Every little detail has been thought of - from the coffee/tea delivered to you in the morning, to the turn-down service in the evening -
Manager Response: Hello Rae,  I really think you captured the heart of the property very well with your glowing descriptions of all our little details. We're glad we could provide you with a great space for you to unwind and experience all that we have to offer. The whole team was happy to hear they could give you the best possible trip to Laguna and we really hope to see you back again soon!

Summary Heading: Feels like coming home, but with better cocktails
Summary: Spent a wonderful evening and night in February. Staff was exceptional, food delicious and locally sourced, and the cocktails are that of dreams.  The vibe is warm and encourages connection with the local essence of Laguna and fellow patrons of the hotel. Enjoy the common living room fireside, play board games and become consumed in beautiful conversation with friends and new friends alike. I will certainly be back!
Manager Response: Hello Cait,  It's great to hear that you enjoyed our soulful vibe and were able to take in the full experience of our living room. The essence of our property is to provide a great environment for you to unplug and enjoy the little things. We thank you for the kind words and hope you make it back to visit us soon!

Summary Heading: Feels like home away, from home.
Summary: This beautiful hotel is well thought out and feels just like home. The staff, especially Cohdy is welcoming, and attended to all of our needs. The food & curation of the hotel is like nothing that I have ever experienced before. The chef attended to our dietary needs & anything we needed was there before we even asked.   I would highly recommend this hotel for a staycation, romantic getaway & especially for a solo retreat to recharge. You will feel like you have been transported into a little world of your own, in the heart of Laguna!
Manager Response: Hello Kelly,  It's always nice to see that one of our team members was able to make a lasting impression and made you feel the spirit of what we like to provide our guests. We have let the Chefs know about your feedback and they appreciate all the warm praise. Thank you for recommending us to anyone looking for a recharge and we hope to have you back in Laguna for another memorable experience very soon!

Summary: I'm not even sure where to begin.  Everything stated in all of the positive reviews on this site are true and then some!  I made a last minute decision to take a weekend trip to Laguna Beach before starting a new job and had seen a lot of postings for Hotel Joaquin on IG and, boy, am I glad I made the wise choice of staying here!  The most important thing to know about this property is that the minute you get there all of the stress you may have been holding on to will quickly leave your body.  Between the beautiful location minutes from Shaw's Cove to the impeccable staff who are there to take care of your every whim, you are transported to a place where you don't have a care in the world and can just enjoy the beauty that surrounds you.  I cannot say enough good things about
Manager Response: Hello Sabrina,  I am happy to see that you were able to make a special connection with our team and that they made a lasting impression on your time with us. Its always great to hear that you were able to take in all that we strive to give to our guests...the home away from home feel. From our entire team, thank you for all the kindness and we hope to see you back for your birthday trip!

Summary: First and foremost the hotel staff are the real stars of the Hotel Joaquin, they were always very happy to help, exceptionally friendly, respectful, and greet you with sincere warmth. We booked through a third party vendor and we were not sure which room we would get, but we got Perch and it was appropriately named. I really loved the views (ocean and herb garden), comfortable day beds, and the record player with lots of great records. The bathroom was wonderful, with both a shower and bathtub and very nice Le Labo amenities. The only draw back is that the room has a glass insert in the door and the light outside kept me up most of the night (that's the reason for 4 stars and not 5). The other part that was a problem is I was unaware that breakfast was included,no one mentioned
Manager Response: Hello Amy, Thank you for the glowing review of our staff! They really go the extra mile to make each guest feel at home and I am happy you were able to experience that during your stay. I apologize that your stay at Hotel Joaquin was anything less than a perfect experience. Please know that I have personally addressed your concerns regarding the explanation of perks and amenity inclusions to our team so that every guest feels they experience all that we have to offer. We hope to see you back for a much improved return stay very soon.

Summary: Loved my stay at Hotel Joaquin! The hotel was the perfect spot for a weekend getaway, the details in the rooms are beautiful and made my stay that much more enjoyable. Staff is amazing and was so attentive and helpful. The food was amazing and loved everything Chef Leo prepared for us. Hope to be back looking at the ocean views soon!
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to leave us such a kind review. We are so glad that you enjoyed your room and that the staff was so attentive to you during your time here! We hope you are able to come for another getaway soon.  Warmest Regards,  Reinhard Neubert General Manager

Summary: Absolutely loved staying here for the weekend! The hotel was so beautiful and the perfect place to come and unwind for the weekend. The food was to die for and the hospitably was great. I loved that my room had a record player included as well! It was such a great touch that made me feel right at home. My room also had a ocean view which was fantastic to wake up to in the morning. Would come back in a heartbeat!
Manager Response: We are glad you were able to unwind and relax while at our property! Next time you come, definitely reach out and if you have any record request we can curate your music in your room for your next visit.   We look forward to welcoming you back in a heartbeat as well!  Warmest Regards,  Reinhard Neubert General Manager

Summary: As a Laguna Beach local, I’ve frequented most of the hotel choices in town and have my standard go-to’s to accommodate different budgets, lengths of stay, location, etc. Until now.  My weekend stay at Hotel Joaquin was an unplanned, last-minute surprise getaway with an out-of-town friend. WE NEVER LEFT. From the moment we arrived, we were greeted with such warmth and personalized service (and a delicious cocktail), I felt like the staff was just as excited to have us there as we were. There was no sterile front lobby, no polyester blazers – just a streamlined welcome with an understated elegance … and I already mentioned the cocktail.  Their dining and bar area has a living room feel, and where we spent several hours playing Scrabble by the fire and chatting with their chef,
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your kind review! I believe our agents are thrilled as well to not have a sterile lobby and polyester blazers! We are very glad you enjoyed your time at our beach house and our welcome cocktails (which are always a great bonus!)   We are so happy that you enjoyed Saline! We thrive to have the freshest and locally sourced ingredients in all our dishes. Please do not steal Leo though, he just had a baby!  We hope we get to welcome you back to our beach house soon for more relaxing vibes by the fire.  Warmest Regards,  Reinhard Neubert General Manager

Summary: Thank you all so much for the really special night we had at the Hotel Joaquin in Laguna Beach.  We arrived to a staff of smiling faces greeted us and form the minute we walked in I realized this wasn’t going to be a typical hotel stay. It felt like we were being greeted into someones' front room. Sit down, make yourself comfy, could we get you a drink? And the outfits the staff wore are perfect.  The guy who showed us to our room made us feel right at home, telling us about how everything would work. My wife and I felt we were being cosseted in a cozy but luxurious retreat. Drinks at sunset, dinner when you’re ready (and it was delicious) and coffee brought to your room in the morning.  We had made a vague plan to go paddle boarding but never left the hotel. Even the fact we
Manager Response: We are so happy to hear that you were treated with the true beach house hospitality while you were staying with us! We are very glad to have you as a part of our Hotel Joaquin family. We chose each detail with care and it feels great to have those details thoroughly appreciated! We are so glad you enjoyed your time and we hope to welcome you back very soon!  Warmest Regards,  Reinhard Neubert General Manager

Manager Response: Thank you Bailey for your detailed review. We are happy to hear that you were able to enjoy our restaurant, Saline, during your stay. Manager Response: Thank you for your thoughtful review on our property. We are thrilled to know that each detail was appreciated that we have curated around Hotel Joaquin. Their kitchen/bar were also very accommodating to our special

Make sure you take advantage of the record player -- it's such a warm touch.  I can't say enough nice things about Hotel Joaquin, but above all else, the team made us feel like we were all good friends -- so friendly and personable, the best hosts we could've asked for. I can't wait to go back to Hotel Joaquin!
